alert.note: Alert for Coastal Indian River; Coastal Martin; Coastal St. Lucie; Inland Indian River; Inland Martin; Inland St. Lucie; Okeechobee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 11:46AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of St. Lucie, eastern Okeechobee, southeastern Indian River and Martin Counties through 1245 PM EDT... At 1146 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles east of Fort Drum to 10 miles northwest of Tradition to 6 miles southwest of J And S Fish Camp. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Port Saint Lucie, Jupiter, Walton, Fort Pierce and Stuart. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
